oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Farmers Markets - Social and Economic Benefits
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Peters, Michael
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
Food systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This report is the result of the study I undertook through attending conferences, meetings with key players in the food industry, visits to a number of farms, farmers markets and other stakeholders in Europe, New Zealand and the USA along with internet research and reading relevant industry reports. This report shows the opportunities that Farmers Markets afford the three main stakeholders, the vendor, the customer and the community. Where synergy exists among these stakeholders you can have a very successful market and a real alternative to the commodities market.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Peters, Michael (2013) Farmers Markets - Social and Economic Benefits. .
